alert.note: Alert for Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 1:55AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following county, Buckingham. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 152 AM EDT, The Slate River at Arvonia remains above the flood stage of 12 feet. At 145 AM EDT, the stage was 12.8 feet and slowly rising. Flooding in low-lying woods and fields can be expected at 12 feet. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Slate River, Rocky Creek, Crooked Creek, James River, Muddy Creek and Sharps Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Buckingham County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
